pros: Such a positive and rewarding place to work. Management really cares about company and employees and it shows! Can’t say enough great things about this company!
cons: No cons to share from me!

pros: Doesn't get any better than this! Incredibly smart and transparent leadership team, solid products and solutions, solving very interesting industry problems alongside smart and driven people. One of the best company cultures you can imagine. Everyone is so nice, success is celebrated in a big way, and employees live the core values. Excellent perks and travel industry benefits. Tons of opportunities to learn and grow.
cons: None really. Unless moving fast and learning something new every day is not your thing.
advice_to_mgmt: More of the same you have been doing!

review_title: Huge opportunity to make a difference
pros:
-Lots of runway in dynamic space
-Seasoned Leadership team that wants to win and cares about employees
-CEO and his team are very approachable and willing to help or answer questions
-Profitable and strong growth trajectory
-Great location for SF office
cons: -Unlimited PTO. There is flexibility to take time off but would prefer a set amount of vacation that is earned and builds.
advice_to_mgmt: Execute and hold teams/ regions accountable that are not.

review_title: Favorite company I've worked for so far
pros: Incredible growth opportunities, forward thinkers, inspiring leadership, great culture, a company that teaches you something new everyday.
cons: Cross team collaboration can be limited at times but is definitely improving.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep up the stellar work!

pros: Everyone is super sweet and friendly.
cons: There are no downsides to working here.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep on doing what you're doing!

pros: Executive Leadership is humble and incredible. They are a genuine team of people who lead by example. It's not lip service. I'm SO happy I made the move to Sojern! The entire recruiting process from start to finish was quick and impressive.
cons: It's not a con but would be an asset to have onsite IT team in SF to assist new hires with on-boarding and team members with any IT issues that arise.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep up the exceptional work! I love working at Sojern!

pros: Great overall culture, working independently within a framework of goals
cons: Intense and constant change, but for the right person, makes is fun
advice_to_mgmt: Keep the growth coming, while resources & nascent structure rises at similar pace

pros: Great unlimited PTO policy, cool and smart people, fun culture, lot of free food and team events, ok benefits (could be better 401k) great managers that care about your future. This is not your typical old school office environment, they provide laptops and standing desk, fun open door office and everyone can interact with each-other, which makes it fun.
cons: No matching 401K, regions are not connected and communication falls short, company moves too fast and creates inconsistency which can make it very stressful. Strategies are very general instead of considering it by market. Immaturity kids can be seen within different teams, and for managers it can be stressful since there is an entitlement culture at times.
advice_to_mgmt: Don't get scare of growing and holding people more accountable. You can't please everyone, at one point you need to get rid of the "start up" mentality. Have realistic and achievable goals.

review_title: Old school culture and poor management
pros:
-Nice office and location
-Good snacks
-Office Manager is great and helpful!
-Average pay
cons:
-Micromanaging culture
-Old school processes that requires a lot of manual work
-Only select old timers are happy here
-Unlimited vacation and work from home policies are just namesakes and not really encouraged

pros:
Smart & genuine peers/colleagues
Better than average pay & benefits
cons:
Generic programmatic product
Lots of manual work
Constant change & reorganizations
Some folks in management are immature and not deserving of being a manager
Weak senior leadership

review_title: If you like change, you'll love Sojern
pros: Fast, fun, friendly. Sojern is a great company and I'm insanely grateful for the opportunities they've given me. Leadership is experienced and accesible. You'll get what you want if you ask, work hard, and prove yourself.
cons: 500 person startup. There are a lot of things going on at once.
advice_to_mgmt: As busy and stressed as you may be, take the time to invest even more in the people.

pros:
-The culture
-The people
-The fast paced environment
-The autonomy and flexibility
cons: I don't have any cons with Sojern. Business does move quickly, so you have to be willing to put in the hours. We have a lot of fun doing it though.
advice_to_mgmt: Continue to operate at a fast paced, having high expectations for your employees, and creating a fun and friendly work environment.

pros: Best company I have ever worked for. Best career decision yet. Inclusive, loaded with culture, understanding to all situations that come up (death in the fam in my case) and willing to train at every avenue. All about the growth and support!
cons: Yesterday was my 4 month anniversary, none yet. Although I might be slightly buttered up from one of the best times of my life, the annual global conference.
advice_to_mgmt: KEEP ON KEEPIN ON! THANKS FOR ALL YOU DO

review_title: Innovated and fast paced. Fun place to work!
pros: The team here is great and the company really puts an emphasis on team building events. Although the envionrment is fast paced, I feel that I have the opportunity to have the opportunity to grow and have a high impact here.
cons: Sometimes change happens very fast and some information is lost in the process.
advice_to_mgmt: More focus on internal communication and manager training.

pros:
- Energetic/passionate People
- Global network
- Startup Culture
- Flexible time off when you need it
cons:
- With the constant change, its hard to see how you fit in to the bigger picture of the company’s organization.
- Recognition is not always given.
- No opportunity for further education.
- No goals, or opportunities to move up (unless you move laterally)
- Goal making not taken seriously.
- Lack of communication from management about structural changes (between San Francisco and Omaha chiefly)
- No matching 401k, tuition reimbursement, or any other major benefits
advice_to_mgmt: - Create a development plan for people when they are brought on to the company. Even talk about it during the interview. Show that they are valued for their skills, and follow through on it.

pros: Culture is great and is a fun place to work!
cons: Can be a pro or con depending on how you view it but everything is constantly changing.

pros:
- Sojern hires the most motivated and engaged people I have ever worked with
- Always on the leading edge of industry knowledge/technology/tools
- Company culture is unmatched, the most positive and inclusive place I have ever worked
cons: - Sojern is constantly changing/adapting which can be a struggle at times, but offers a lot of exciting challenges
advice_to_mgmt: - Keep doing what you're doing!!

review_title: Amazing Culture at a Fast-Growing Company
pros:
The people are fantastic. Everyone is so nice and so genuine, no mean girls here.
The Company is growing like crazy. It's a great time to join!
Great benefits and travel perks.
cons: Typical growing pains of a young company
advice_to_mgmt: Keep up the good work!

pros:
Some of the co-workers are cool.
The kitchen used to have good snacks provided
Cool view

That's all I got
cons:
Management loves to talk and not listen
The company promises a lot and never follows through
This is the kind of meetings we have.... all the time

We here at Sojern realize that it is better to transition compellingly than to target virally. We understand that if you reintermediate extensibly then you may also generate interactively. Think granular. Think killer. Think extensible. But don't think all three at the same time. It comes off as improbable, but it's realistic! Think end-to-end. Think social-network-based. Think B2B. But don't think all three at the same time. Without iteration, you will lack cyber-cross-media affiliate-based obfuscation. We apply the proverb "Grass doesn't grow on a racetrack" not only to our macro-out-of-the-box versioning but our ability to reinvent. We will amplify our power to iterate without depreciating our power to cultivate. Our technology takes the best features of XForms and FOAF. Without meticulously-planned e-tailers, platforms are forced to become long-term. Think frictionless. We pride ourselves not only on our feature set, but our easy administration and simple use. We will integrate the ability of markets to matrix.
advice_to_mgmt: Listen, Listen, Listen - Wouldn't that be ironic if this worked?

review_title: My Best Employment Experience to Date
pros:
Sojern is fast paced, growing rapidly, and constantly changing. This allows employees to grow, be challenged, and test new ideas!

Employee input is valued and encouraged. If you want to forge a path and try something new, employees have the support of their peers and management.

Sojern focuses on work/life balance. They encourage taking personal time to travel the world and instill flexibility within your role.

Sojern has fun! The work hard, play hard mentality is instilled throughout the organization. Hard work is rewarded and employees are recognized for their efforts.

Because of the constant change and growth of the company, each day brings something different and employees are constantly learning new skills.
cons:
Training leaves something to be desired. Due to constant change, training given to new hires may not be pertinent to their role once they move into their full role.

At times there is lack of uniformity in processes or communication due to the nature of the business and the evolvement of the business.
advice_to_mgmt: Continue encouraging employees to take on projects that interest them and maintaining work/life balance. Focus resources on creating uniform processes and training.

pros: Some smart people that work in the organization. Do a good job of company events and make it fun environment to be around.
cons: Need more transparency in performance good or bad.
advice_to_mgmt: Stick to the endemic business and grow from there.

pros: Feels like a family. Nice, fun coworkers. Good work/life balance. Interesting work for the most part. Management is making good decisions. Steady positive growth for years now.
cons: Work is usually interesting but sometimes you need to take one for the team. That's life.
advice_to_mgmt: Management has a great positive attitude that makes us all feel happy and confident in the direction of the company; keep it up!

pros: Great benefits and compensation: health insurance and travel benefits
cons: Nothing specific that comes to mind

review_title: Sojern is the best company I've worked for
pros:
They truly care for their employees
Everyone's opinions are welcome and encouraged
Everyone is willing to help
No micro-management
cons: Fast paced-- Things evolve quickly here. I personally like it, but I see how it could be frustrating for others.

pros: The culture at Sojern simply cannot be beaten. People are friendly and focus on team aspects to make the company more successful as a whole.
cons: There are constant changes to the company which are sometimes hard to keep up with.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep looping in employees on changes occurring in the company, and keep seeking feedback

pros: Company truly values its employees and is committed to growth, employee input & allows individuals to take ownership in the results & success of the firm. Global employee base allows for a challenging, engaging work environment.
cons: None to report so far!
advice_to_mgmt: Keep asking for employee feedback and input regularly. You've done a fabulous job of engaging your people so far and the commitment shows.

pros: I absolutely love it here! The people, the atmosphere, the work! I couldn't have found a better place to join!
cons: Not enough time in the day!

review_title: Amazing employer that provided me with challenging and meaningful work
pros:
Hands down, some of the smartest people I've met work at this company. No one was afraid to dissect a problem, find a solution, roll-up their sleeves, and handle the work.

People were treated fairly by senior leaders and were expected to do the same to everyone. The culture was created by the top and instilled all the way to the bottom. Senior leaders were approachable and welcomed it.

I admired how no one ever hid behind an email or approached topics in a passive-aggressive fashion. Open, honest, and direct conversations were the norm and set the tone week over week.

The amount of transparency at this company is second to none. You're treated like an owner and honesty amongst teammates are both promoted and expected. It was such a growing organization when I was there that new employees were being added to multiple offices at any given point. Recruiting did a great job of making sure that the new employees were "the right fit" versus growing for the sake of growth.
cons: I wouldn't necessarily say that this is a negative, but things move so quickly that it can be hard to keep up. You are never left to be in place where you won't succeed, but because you're treated like an owner with autonomy, you're expected (as you should be) to do the work that comes with it.
advice_to_mgmt:
No advice, but thank you for making my time there enjoyable and a rewarding experience. It is evident that the leadership team truly believes in it's people, their abilities, and the company's mission. You always put people first because you knew that was how objectives would be achieved, which was fantastic and appreciated by all.

Best of luck as you march-on and shape the advertising world. The company will continue to do amazing things.

pros: well connected and savvy leadership
cons: growing very quickly, good upside but can be disorganized

review_title: High growth and global expansion with a true focus on employees
pros:
* My manager and leadership are focused on creating opportunities for me to grow and be exposed to multiple facets of the business
* The most talented and collaborative team I have ever worked with - egos are checked at the door and we all strive to do our best together
* All ideas and creative solutions are constantly encouraged and often implemented. Voices are equally heard and valued
* Leadership nurtures a culture of feedback and transparency
* Vacations are strongly encouraged with a focus on work / life balance
* Visiting other offices is encouraged!
cons: * Fast paced environment - over the years focus on resources and tools has greatly improved to support the pace and growth
advice_to_mgmt: Keep championing an environment of collaboration, diversity, winning as a team and risk-taking

pros: Great people, fantastic culture, reasonable hours, great location, fun problems to work on.
cons: Cross-functional knowledge varies from group-to-group, so often need to break down concepts.

review_title: Sojern goes the extra mile for its employees
pros: On the first day I got hired as a Campaign Coordinator, I had a meeting with my supervisor. He informed me that he knew that I had an extensive math background and was giving me the tools I needed to become an analyst at Sojern. This concept of nurturing the talents of each employee blew me away. An absolutely amazing atmosphere to work in, and upbeat colleagues. They also provide free food, and drinks which is essential to me too. Best job I have ever had.
cons: Sometimes we will have rush orders that may have us staying a tad late. I've only had one in the 90 days I have worked here.

pros: Collaborative working environment that encourages open communication and transparency across all teams. Strong management team. The overall team is built with smart individuals with diverse backgrounds which make working at Sojern extremely enjoyable. Each role has the ability to have a high impact.
cons: Things are extremely fast paced as the industry is which is not suitable for everyone.

pros: Great atmosphere, fun office, great opportunities for advancement
cons: Small office sizes and some travel
advice_to_mgmt: Focus a little bit less on team building

pros:
The top reason to work at Sojern is to work alongside a great group of people in a healthy work environment and culture. You develop strong friendships, tackle problems as a team, and make an impact all without the long nights and chronic pressure you might have elsewhere. I feel Sojern understands we're most productive when we're happy and rested.

Besides that, there are strong health benefits, the downtown SF office is in a great location, the future is bright, and the leadership aware.
cons: There are some occasional growing pains as Sojern matures from an advertising startup to an adtech platform. Leadership seems to be taking the right steps to address these, such as improving product management, but we're not there yet.
advice_to_mgmt: Full steam ahead!

pros:
-Strong leadership and communication. The managers at Sojern advocate for their employees by regularly meeting with them, asking for feedback and providing guidance, and ensuring they have what they need in order to successfully do their job.
-Your feedback is always welcome at Sojern and management strives to put action plans in place to make improvements based upon the feedback they receive.
-Sojern invests in their employees by providing educational and other growth opportunities to employees.
cons: -As the company is still relatively young in the programmatic advertising industry, there are sometimes small growing pains as the industry changes and we add employees. As expected in this stage, there are still some consistencies that need to be developed in the internal processes.
advice_to_mgmt: -Keep making your employees a top priority and your employees will keep making Sojern a top priority.

pros: awesome culture, great colleagues, can feel we are close to something big
cons: Small company so adoption can be slow.

pros: The only people whom don't appreciate Sojern are new college grads who think all offices have free food, ping pong, shuffle board, & unlimited PTO. Anyone whose worked anywhere else highly values everything about Sojern.
cons: I have no Cons. Great Job. Can't ask for anything more.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep doing what your doing....

pros: Its a fun work environment, and its nice to have snacks and some lunch items available. Some of the ops managers are fabulous!
cons:
I guess I am not entirely sure why my experience differed from most the reviews on here; I did not have a great experience here. When I was hired, I was lead to believe that i would be promoted quickly based on my experience in the industry, but, I was a person who put my head down and worked, and that does not go over well here. It seemed as they promoted the people who 'worked the political system' no matter how many clients they lost, stole work from others, and how much crap they talked about co-workers. I legitimately felt that if I did all the wrong things I would be promoted, and my morals and ethics simply wouldn't allow me to stoop to her level.
Secondly, sales rules all. No matter how much work your salesperson threw on your plate that should be their work, it didn't matter. More than once my salesperson would drop massive RFPs on my plate due the next day, and then post on social media out doing something, and the management of ops was powerless to stop it.
Third, the SF office really had too much power and was out of touch with the Omaha office. Most of the decisions made from SF work on the coast, but don't work in the Midwest.
advice_to_mgmt:
Keep focus on what matters. and make sure decisions are made with everyone in mind, not just the squeaky wheels in SF.
Invest and listen to Ops. If they all leave, the machine stops working.

pros: Fun place to work thats about it....
cons: Huge growing pains, zero infrastructure, lastly most people here including management have no urgency fix broken issues

pros: Innovative, forward-looking company that takes pride in their work, employees, and culture.
cons: It can be difficult to keep up if you are not on your game and willing to adapt to an ever-changing industry.

pros: Google like environment, Fantastic executive leadership, fun people great work environment.
cons: My (middle) manager was untrustworthy. All others I knew were honest. Special circumstances/exemptions were made for employees whose family members were investors in the company.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep growing the company, you guys are doing a great job!

pros: Love the culture, lots of A players, great industry expertise. We are on a good growth trajectory, CAGR is extremely high for several years running. We have a lot going for us at the moment.
cons: Hard to think of cons, but of course there are negatives. If you want catered lunch everyday, we don't have that. If you want to work somewhere that tells you every tactical thing to do and how to do it, maybe this isn't the right place for you. We don't always know what to do, we get things done by trying hard, and so sometimes there are challenges. Imagine working in a 200+ person startup that is still figuring stuff out. It can sometimes be chaotic, and there can be times were the workload is a lot. But compared to other startups, Sojern truly does offer work/life balance.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep it going! We love working here. Leadership team is conscientious, knowledgable, and obviously cares about this company and the people who work here.

review_title: A breath of fresh air in the Bay Area
pros:
Sojern is truly an extraordinary place to work. Having worked at other tech companies in the Bay Area, Sojern is a breath of fresh air. Never before have I been as trusted, empowered, and supported in my work as here at Sojern. If you have an idea to change a process or try a new idea, your team, all the way up to leadership will support you, provided you've got good reasons and a solid plan.

So many people in the company and warm, friendly, and fun to work with. I enjoy going to work everyday because I get to sit with my fun, smart team and do work I am interested in. Much of leadership is smart, interesting, and available—something that is rare to find and a pleasure to work with.

Beyond the amazing culture, the perks are nice too! Good benefits, flexibility with your schedule, free food (not just random 'free snacks' like other places, but genuinely good, healthy food).
cons: The job and company is what you make of it. If you are one to lean in, work hard, and help others, you'll be met with lots of success and encouragement. If you need more direction or motivation to grow and develop, you may find it a bit more difficult.

pros: Generally a good crowd of dedicated people especially account managers and analysts. Company is spread out across the country so lags in communication and sometimes cooperation.
cons: Can be a bit of a popularity contest and some managers - mine in particular - made very clear choices about picking favorites and the lack of fairness bred resentment.

review_title: I can honestly say I LOVE my job!
pros: The people make working here great! Sojern hires top talent which makes more awesome team work where everyone pitches in and goes above and beyond. Other pros- flexibility & understanding when personal issues arise outside of work, fun atmosphere, willingness to help one another exceed, empowering us to make decisions, and awesome management!
cons: Since we are growing so fast we are playing catch up sometimes to get standard processes in place.
advice_to_mgmt: Over-communication while we grow is key to our success!

pros: The culture at Sojern is innovative, fast-paced and competitive. Employees are young but are talented and smart. Everyone is very open and friendly and likes to have fun. Leadership doesn't micromanage and lets employees find what work style best suits them. The onboarding process happens very quickly so you have to have confidence in your ability even if you don't know the industry well. They have made a lot of improvements to the New Hire Training which is very detailed.
cons: Because it is a newer company, there isn't a lot of structure when it comes to introducing new processes or tools. They have brought in more people to help with this but it can be confusing for a new hire.
advice_to_mgmt: Help create more clearly defined objectives by talking more about long-term goals.

pros: Work/Life Balance, Growing Company, UNLIMITED VACATION, Growth Potential, Time/Schedule Flexibility, Great Culture!
cons: fast growth means workload increases very quickly, bring your learning/thinking caps to training!

pros: Great amenities, perks & bonuses. Friendly & diligent management. A lot of good - hard working people that genuinely care about their co-workers, teams and the success of the company.
cons: Cramped work space, lack of meeting rooms, occasionally long hours. Some times there are unrealistic goals set. Lack of organization in some parts of the sales organization.
advice_to_mgmt: We are often encouraged to have a good work/life balance, but often times - requests from management do not allow for this. Set more realistic expectations. Take in to consideration the shear amount of time some proposals, projects and information takes to put together.

review_title: Sojern, the best place in Omaha to work!
pros: From day one, Sojern has been the best decision I have made when it comes to careers. Coming from Omaha, I did not think that organizations like Sojern (stocked kitchen, weekly happy hours, unlimited PTO) existed. On top of all the amazing benefits, I can also 100% say that I enjoy coming to work everyday. The people here truly care about everyone and value opinions and one of the core values, to "Be Genuine," is exemplified throughout. If you thrive in a rapidly changing, super busy work environment then this is the place for you! My days fly by and I feel like I am making a difference at Sojern.
cons: With an open floor concept it tends to get a bit load, especially when making important phone calls and talking with clients. But just as easy to step into a conference room!
advice_to_mgmt: Keep doing what you are doing, the dynamic of Sojern makes it a great place to be at and I can tell you value your employees opinions.

pros:
I've been here for almost a year now and this company's most important and best asset are its people. The executive leadership is very smart, open and friendly. The employees overall in all of Sojern's offices around the world are exceptionally collaborative and NICE. Opportunities for growth abound, you just have to apply yourself and know what you want to do - it's literally an environment where if you raise your hand, you will be taken up on it, so beware! :-)
The unlimited vacation policy (which people tend to take advantage of in reasonable quantities and without ill effects on their work) is great.
Last, but not least: if you're looking at Sojern and thinking, like I did when I first interviewed "but it's an ad tech company :-( ..." rest assured that it's a very special one indeed. ABSOLUTELY NO DOUCHEBAGGERY, plus, thanks to the focus on travel, their expertise and client set is unique enough that you needn't worry about them dissolving in a puddle of ad:tech failure.
cons:
Like I mentioned above - not a ton of diversity at the top, but it seems like they are aware and making efforts to hear POVs that are different.
Also, the health benefits are 'meh'. No 401k matching, either.
advice_to_mgmt: Again, diversity at the top. I know there isn't an overnight fix for this, but be a bit more proactive about acknowledging the gaps and that you're working on it.

pros:
- A strong seasoned leadership team
- Very transparent culture
- Company truly takes care of its employee's and strives to always "do the right thing"
- Environment that fosters growth and learning
- Smart, talented employees that enjoy collaborating
- Managers support their teams and genuinely care
- The reasons to work here are much deeper than the usual tech perks, but we have those too: Unlimited PTO, company events, happy hours, volunteer opportunities, free food, etc.
cons: - As with any start up, changes can happen quickly, but I've never seen that as too much of a con

review_title: Opportunities for Growth/Great People to work with
pros:
- In all of the companies I've worked for, I've never worked with such an amazing group of people. It's truly a case of "like attracts like", and because the company does a great job of finding the right Senior Management, it filters down into every hire.
- The CEO understands the value of people in the company, and is completely accessible and transparent to anyone who asks.
- Great culture - the company is what you make it. If you want to organize a happy hour or get-together, you're empowered to do that. There's usually one event a month for each office if you're not the organizing type.
cons: - Would love 401k matching!
advice_to_mgmt: As company experiences hyper-growth, continue to keep focus on culture and people. Quality over quantity, as quick hires are often not an overall fit.

pros: Awesome office, casual culture, unlimited vacation
cons: Slow growth for individual employees

pros: Good culture, good management, flexible benefits
cons: Work/Life balance, not great communication

pros:
- A really supportive environment that values their employees' satisfaction and wellbeing
- Opportunities for career growth within a fast-moving company
- A highly creative and collaborative community of people that appreciates all viewpoints
- A strong leadership team that puts their employees first and gives consistent feedback
- Fun office environment
cons: There are a few growing pains with fast growth, such as resource limitations and a fast-paced environment.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep up the good work!

pros:
- Incredible leadership team. They all care about employees and strive to be the best.
- Coworkers and Leadership constantly recognize efforts and value. I have received some of the most thoughtful recognition from coworkers and leaders.
- Opportunities for growth. This is the place to create and share ideas. I have been given endless opportunities to create and develop projects.
- Team - Collaboration is at the heart of the company.
- Global - Extensive insights and opportunities to learn and grow globally.
- Fun - This is a company that knows how to have fun!
cons: - Would like to see us grow faster
advice_to_mgmt: Continue to be transparent and accessible. Push us to new heights!

pros: It's basically like working with your closest friends and family. I loved coming in to work everyday. They really care about the people that work for them and they show it through the culture. There's a massive kitchen that they supply food for employees every week.
cons: Product can be a tough sell in the growing industry. It's a constantly changing company so if you're someone who doesn't like change then I would advise against working here.
advice_to_mgmt: Stay the same! Every manager really cares for the people that work for them, and you all really want everyone to succeed.

pros: Great group of people- interesting product
cons: difficult being in a remote location
advice_to_mgmt: better communication

pros:
Amazing management. I seriously have the best boss ever! Makes an effort to connect constantly even though they are located at a different office. Backs me up on my goals and ideas. Makes me feel appreciated and want to come to work!
Great benefits, unlimited PTO, open office layout, casual atmosphere, great opportunities to give back to the environment and community.
Great colleges. Everyone is very smart and passionate about what they do! This pushes everyone to work smarter and harder.
Growth! Just opened offices in Singapore and Dubai.
Exciting industry
cons: Fast paced, and change is constant here. But that is the industry. Growth is expected, so if you aren't able to move fast and work independently, you wont make it here.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep being reachable to your employees. I love that all the CEO's are a part of the new hire orientation. Management really makes an effort to be reachable even when visiting the other offices. Your voice really is heard here.

review_title: Associate Account Manager- optimize marketing campaigns and provide account management services to clients.
pros: Great company culture. Great pay and benefits. flexible work schedule- and you get to work with a lot of really intelligent and cool people!
cons: They are very selective on hiring- and training process needs improvement. It is a start up so there is constantly change.

pros:
-Start up culture
-PTO
-smart and fun people
-growth potential
cons:
-unorganized at times
-some leadership
-personal growth

review_title: Great Leadership team and lots of opportunities to grow.
pros: The team is great, super friendly down to earth people. They are very passionate and come from very interesting backgrounds with a lot of experience in the industry. There are office events and great snacks and lunches every so often... oh and unlimited vacation!
cons: Growing really fast, so you need to be able to move fast and keep up... if you need a lot of hand holding and aren't able to execute quickly may not be the best fit.

review_title: Great company with even better work environment
pros:
- Great company culture
- Challenging but rewarding
- Solid leadership
- Good compensation and benefits
- Unlimited paid vacation
cons: It's fast-paced and change is the norm, but that's what the digital media industry is all about.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep up the good work and transparency. I worked here for 3 1/2 years and am proud to be apart of this company's growth.

pros: Fast-paced environment with super smart people on a mission to transform the travel industry. Cool.
cons: Evolving quickly which can leave some people behind the curve.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep doing what you're doing - we're on a roll!

pros:
The people are intelligent
Good company office
cons:
Few benefits
No raises/promotions
Manager is incompetent
Sexism
no 401k matching
awful healthcare
They don't fire people. They just make them so uncomfortable that they eventually leave. I've seen it happen multiple times and it never leaves a good feeling.

SF office has few benefits and isn't on par with other tech companies in the area. And when you see your few benefits (like the once a week lunch) vanish then you get nervous about the future and what we do have money for.
advice_to_mgmt:
Have an anonymous manager review system implemented. It doesn't count as anonymous if your manager can figure out who said what, or worse, misidentify and blame others for someone else's comments.
An unlimited vacation policy doesn't count if you guilt people when they take vacation. (Unless you're management, then you can do whatever guilt-free apparently.)

review_title: Sojern, an awesome place to work!
pros: Challenging work, fast paced environment, great people, and everyone is incredibly intelligent! Sojern is on it's way up and I'm glad that I'm now on the ride. Between the Friday afternoon beer hour, ping pong, stocked fridge, and shuffleboard table - there is something for everyone if you need a short break in the day.
cons: None so far, the place is awesome!
advice_to_mgmt: Continue to paint the growth image. It's one that will get everyone excited to come to work everyday!

pros:
Amazing culture - very open and they keep all employees in the loop. Relaxed management lets you work in peace trusting that you know what you need to accomplish on a daily basis.
Fast paced environment - always changing to better the company, so it definitely keeps you on your toes.
cons: Lots of change, which could be negative for some people. Things are constantly different quarter after quarter but only to better the company.

pros:
- Amazing talent
- Fantastic Leadership Team
- Dedicated boss and mentor
- Global - dedicated to expanding
- Sincere open communications
- Super cool office and location
- Fun! Coolest people to hangout with!
- Unlimited PTO
cons: There isn't anything I can think of. It's been a great experience.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep investing in your employees! Continue to develop meaningful career paths. Would love more training and more opportunities to work in other offices temporarily.

review_title: Meh. Not what I was expecting. Copy/Paste
pros: Good people to work with. Open atmosphere
cons: Unorganized start up culture. Going the right direction though.
advice_to_mgmt: Be more transparent with your employees. My boss didn't talk to me for months while on the job, and that's not how a successful leader runs things.

pros: Small company who is growing quickly. Venture capitalist backed, great benefits, relaxed work environment
cons: Hire young inexperienced people who are still mentally in high school. Pay could be better.

pros: Great leadership, very accessible. Good product
cons: Middle Management could be better.

pros:
Good working environment such as snacks, coffee and event lunches etc. thanks to office manager
Interesting product development of late with Facebook and SEM
Training and development is encouraged
cons:
Repetitive work and very manual systems are very limited internally and poorly connected
Long hours and answering emails out of hours is expected along with heavy SFDC chatter and Slack usage never allows you to switch off. Managers send weekly updates on a Saturday morning!
Poor management who will rarely fight your corner or offer promotions
Lack of structure and too many people managing projects for the sake of managing projects
advice_to_mgmt: You need to change the management approach be more flexible and listen to employees. Lead by example and send communication updates Mon - Friday this is not a healthy work ethic and should not be encouraged.

review_title: Amazing first month in a well structured work environment
pros:
- Open communication within the 400+ employees worldwide
- easy to reach out to individuals
- induction plan (30/60/90 days) well structured
- online training course are great to learn the products during the first weeks
- Direct manager super friendly and easy to approach
- Team spirit is strong, values are truly applied on a daily basis (win as a team for exemple)
cons: No cons so far (This is my 6th work experience in 10 years time) and it has been the best first month since then
advice_to_mgmt: Keep being so close to your teams, that's the key of success!

review_title: Amazing company with thriving culture and great people
pros:
-People are it's greatest asset and the company treats employees well with numerous benefits.
-Managers are amazing and cares for the well-being of their sub-ordinates
- Flat culture with a great environment for learning and development
- Everyone is friendly and willing to teach
cons: -None, it is an amazing company to work for and I love coming to work each day, it feels very much like I'm working with friends
advice_to_mgmt: - Keep doing what you are doing, keep this amazing culture as the company grows

review_title: Exciting company with lots of opportunity
pros:
Sojern is a great place to work - with global best in class solutions right at the forefront of digital marketing + travel verticalisation + strategic partnerships with the world biggest and best travel and media business, all means delivering great outcomes for clients, which ultimately makes the job rewarding, fun and exciting.

A really great place to work, fast-paced, scale globally, good history and exciting future.
cons: Very few to be honest - Scaling quickly past 500 people and executing acquisitions, whilst great for the business, can product growing pains. But I am sure most would agree are well worth it and par for the course.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep up the good work - onwards and upwards.

pros:
Senior management team and CEO charismatic
Fun environment, dedicated to team building
Good stock options
Lots to learn and grow knowledge & connections
Lots of opportunity to travel
cons:
Overly needy colleagues who seek praise all the time even when doing necessary value added work
It’s a sales house, revenue matters. Yet there is unfair distribution of opportunities and rewards. No standardization of rewards and promotions. Some sales people are free riders and promoted quickly despite not hitting targets or showcasing talent
Too many overlaps. Probably the only company where two sets of teams can enter the same hospitality chain and promote pretty much identifical products just packaged in a different way
advice_to_mgmt:
Set rules and logic for promotion across the board, it shouldn’t be on the whims of managers.
Promote accountability on sellers
Hire for growth needs, plan in advance
Be open to talent decision for lateral moves, or else you end up disengaging them
Be competitive in innovating but don’t throw too many products out there at once until 100% ready. You have too much to lose, you can adopt a fail fast learn fast mentality

review_title: Fantastic business with a strong leadership, vision and strategy for success. Awesome culture
pros: The People, product and vertical
cons: Very few cons I can think of

pros: Friendly team, multicultural, lots of team events, constant learnings and the team are always trying to figure things out to drive more sales and happy customers. Fast paced. Collaborative.
cons: There are no SOPs but this is half the fun.

review_title: Best company I've worked for so far
pros: The People, Values, Dynamic, International, Honest
cons: Communication across offices is a work in progress in some cases
advice_to_mgmt: Keep up the amazing work!

pros: Great environment, lots of opportunities, competitive product, lots of support from the team for new hires, amazing management and all the benefits of working in a US based company!
cons: Nothing major, maybe the job is more SDR+SE+AM then just sales call.
advice_to_mgmt: Hire a Spanish/Italian/French speaker AM

review_title: Great company building something really special
pros:
The values
The product
The team
The social scene
The results driven for clients
The vision for the future
The data and the signals it gives
cons: I don't have a bad word to say, I loved my time there.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep it going, you're building something really special. Expand successfully outside of the USA and you'll make it a truly global success story.

review_title: A great place understand digital, data and travel globally
pros:
* At the forefront of digital, data and travel
* Developing the offering and coverage in a fast and sustainable manner
* Focused on maintaining a good culture and motivated workforce
*
cons:
I don't really think there are negatives of working here rather it's important to have a good understanding of what type of business Sojern are and where they are in their stage of development. If this fits well with what you want from your career then you'll find satisfaction in your time here.

At it's heart Sojern is an advertising platform
They are no longer a start up, 300+ people across 10 offices
Profitability and high growth are key
advice_to_mgmt: With continued growth and market change keep iterating the offering and maintaining management structures that can execute new offerings quickly.

review_title: Sounds great! Until you're working there.
pros:
Playroom to go and unwind (you will have long workdays)
Some snacks and breakfast for free
Regular team events
Some travel
Flat organisation, everyone talks to everyone
cons:
I'm very surprised at the positive reviews here. On the other hand, this is an advertising company, and they are keen for everyone to think this employer is flawless, so employees are encouraged to give a good review for Sojern to seem great and win "best workplace" awards. Don't you find it interesting how many fantastic reviews has come in to Glassdoor the past six months, a period where more people than ever has chosen to leave?

Unhealthy work ethic:
You are contracted to work a normal 40 hour week, but it's an unspoken expectation of you to work all the time (including when you're sick, on holidays or during the weekend). Although they tell you in the interview that they promote a great work-life balance, you need to be reachable and available to work at all times. On multiple occasions, team members were in the office with high fever, could barely sit up, having the flu, not going home, as they said "..I need to get this done first, I will then continue to work from home". It's common to start checking work emails from my phone while still in bed at 7am, and not put it down until going to sleep. Not healthy, and does explain why so many people has left the company this year.

Many reviews here say "it's fast paced", that's very true, and it comes to the great cost of the employees who are over worked (14 hour work days are normal). Management will not support you if you start to get tired as a result of being over worked, and will at times then give you even more work just to see if you can take the heat. You need very tough skin to thrive here. It's a very competitive environment in the office, which can get nasty, as everyone wants to do well and stand out.

It's very confusing due to the many changes in the company. Not only is the market fast paced, Sojern has gone through many internal changes lately which makes it a confusing work place. Looks like they attempt to grow faster than they can manage.

Lastly, please note that just because you're a top performer (and can show great measurable results), does not mean you're doing well in the eyes of the management. Sounds confusing? You will know what I mean if you ever work at Sojern.
advice_to_mgmt: Please listen to your employees. Don't just listen to what you want to hear.

review_title: Great company with global expansion and true focus on employees
pros:
The top reason to work at Sojern is to work alongside a great group of people in a healthy work environment and fantastic culture. The company provides great benefits, values and work balance.
 Sojern leadership`s are aware that when employees are happy they are more productive.
cons: Things are extremely fast paced as the industry is which is not suitable for everyone.
advice_to_mgmt: Great leadership, congratulations!

pros:
- Continuous growth
- Positive leadership
- High-paced environment
- Full insurance, travel perks
cons: Avoid Sojern if you are looking for a heavy management structure or a define playbook for your position.

review_title: More than a company, business with a soul
pros:
- smart people
- collaborative environment
- open & transparent communication
- people matters, growth of individual important
- entrepreneurial spirit
cons:
- Not quite ready for global domination. However the management is keen to put the right people in the right place at the right time.
- Growing at a steady pace despite being in a very fast paced & dynamic industry.
- The type of individual who can succeed in this company is one who think on their feet & come up with solutions quickly, persevere & work hard. Not the right environment for individuals who expect quick returns with little effort
advice_to_mgmt: Continue to hire & groom talents. The best people are the ones who think & act as a team, yet treat the business as their own.

pros: Great company culture and awesome people & leadership! Expanding globally and definitely seeing growth in all aspects as a company and individually! Very generous staff welfare too.
cons: It is all good for now!

review_title: An ambitious, friendly and smart business to be part of. A great place to work.
pros:
Cutting edge business model at the forefront of digital media
Clear and decisive plan with transparent long term goals
Supportive work environment, a friendly team in every office!
Solid and approachable leadership team
cons: The usual growing pains of a fast moving business when shipping new product globally
advice_to_mgmt: Keep the culture of a start up as the business matures globally

pros:
- Great product that works and delivers performance
- Upper management has been developing a continued attentiveness to employee needs
- Increased efforts to foster inter-office collaboration
- Focus on building a dynamic team of individuals who work together as one
cons:
- Resource-strapped (though temporary as the company invests time in building local team resources globally)
- Fast-paced growth so expect some levels of uncertainty (but this is also the nature of the industry as a whole)
advice_to_mgmt: You're on the right track - do continue to invest in your employees across the globe as they are the ones that are owning and growing the business in their individual regions

review_title: Best Company I Have Ever Worked For
pros:
- Management that genuinely cares about its employees, and has great foresight and vision. Chosen to focus on how we can constantly do better as a company instead of on the curveballs that competitors throw at us
- Flat organisational hierarchy with great leaders - Pragmatic and honest. If they've made a mistake, they'd admit it, and implement practical steps to do better the next time. This approach is apparent across the whole organisation and I absolutely love it
- Easy to speak to and raise issues with top-levels of management - with your voice being heard and improvements actioned upon; Management constantly seeks feedback on ways to improve and checking on employee satisfaction and morale
- Great opportunities and strategic expansion plans.
- Strategic decision-making, focusing on the long-term potential of growing relationships and delivering success so that both the organisation and clients mutually benefit (and not ripping clients off for short-term profits!)
- Focuses on delivering great products and client experience
- Excellent culture: Embodies 'Winning as a team'! Everyone genuinely wants to help everyone else succeed, and together we will
- Best of the best: Working with really intelligent colleagues who are high-performing and dedicated
- Challenging and rewarding role. Feel extremely valued as an individual and proud to be a member of my team. Can see how the work I'm doing contributes greatly to the organisation's progress
- Lovely working environment and everyone conducts themselves professionally and respectfully, both internally and externally to clients
- Comprehensive benefits program
- Profit-sharing
- Travel benefits
- Opportunities to visit global offices
- Fast-paced and constantly evolving industry. Always something new to learn. Training sessions provided and supportive environment
- Work extremely hard, play extremely hard! Team dinners, drinks and activities organised by colleagues who step up and lead initiatives
- Amazing manager - Doesn't micromanage and trusts me. Great working relationship and doing my best work
- Opportunities to step up and lead, and indicate areas of interest - and managers genuinely support you in your learning or participation in those areas
- Hands-down the best company I have ever worked for!
cons:
- Final round interview was the most difficult ever. Multiple challenging interviews before being made a very good offer
- Can sometimes be a little swamped with day-to-day responsibilities but it's a result of a rapidly expanding organisation. Efforts made to address this through automation and spreading out the workload. Would love to have more time each week to work on side-projects that benefit the greater company
advice_to_mgmt:
- Remember to reward and retain your employees as the company continues onwards to greater heights. Continue to show appreciation both intrinsically and extrinsically to keep everyone happy
- Review and improve compensation plan, and continue to add benefits
- Identify high performers and encourage them - Outline their career trajectory and rewards
- Ensure that the excellent culture is not diluted or worsens as the company seeks to expand exponentially
- Don't be hasty in hiring: Always choose the best fit for the role, and not rush to add headcount. Also, be careful of free-riders or opportunists who want to benefit without actively contributing to the company's progress
- Continue to screen candidates well and not let up on standards
- Have a larger HR team to better manage employee satisfaction and HR functions
- Ensure there is a sense of 'fairness' across different offices and they are not neglected
- Ensure company transitions from a U.S.-centric to global-centric perspective
- Keep following the strategy of delivering superior value and focusing on what we're doing right
- Establish a company-wide certification program
- Employees should be encouraged to spend 5-10% of their time each week on side-projects. Have already seen benefits when employees stepped up and created new tools that benefited the wider team
- Continue to be flexible in meeting future global challenges!

pros:
Fast growth
Strong links between sales and service teams
Strong products
Opportunities to travel
Challenging but caring culture from the Exec team down, open and family feel across the company
Management is very open and accountable
cons:
Product and system rollouts could be improved, has been recognised
Have to be prepared to work very hard and prove yourself to succeed/progress here. It's competitive and there are many high quality people - this can be a pro and a con!
advice_to_mgmt: Continue to be authentic to maintain trust.

review_title: Frustrating due to infancy of company with little to no awareness of their value proposition
pros:
Relaxed work place
Ability to offer ideas
Fair compensation
Good benefits
great audience data
strategic partnerships with airlines
cons:
Limited brand power and awareness in the agency world and client direct
Marginal air coverage in corporate marketing support to get the name of the company out in the marketplace.
Operations has too much influence in sales revenue related decisions
Paperwork reporting heavy
Still a very young company with growing pains of a start up regarding procedures and protocol
advice_to_mgmt:
Invest in a established CMO and develop a strategy that will result in more awareness of the company that will result in driving revenue.

Limit the operation folks in making revenue related business decisions.

Invest in developing a research strategy to go to clients with which will allow for easier access to client level decision makers.

Institute a matching 401K
